location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from Lt-Col Samuel Hennell, Resident in the Persian Gulf, to Arthur Malet, Chief Secretary of the Government Bombay

mods.abstract: Hennell writes that, in previous years, numerous gifts have been received by the Residency from the Imam of Muscat and his son, to an estimated value of 2000 rupees. Hennell states that all these gifts have been 'brought' on the Government Books, and that no return has been made. He therefore suggests that his Lordship in Council consider whether a gift of equivalent value be made to the Imam of Muscat.
